note: The Department of Hospitality and Tourism falls under the Faculty of Applied Sciences and Technology at Sunyani Technical University.
Programmes focus on practical training for Ghana's growing tourism and hospitality sector, with HND Hotel Catering & Institutional Management available in Regular, Weekend, and Evening modes.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology in Tourism Management

fees: Ghanaian Students: GHC 2,640 - 3,100 per semester (estimated 2025/2026 based on Faculty of Applied Sciences rates)
mode: Full-time on-campus lectures and field trips
Industrial attachment at tourism sites and agencies
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus credit passes in three relevant elective subjects
SSSCE: Credit passes (A-D) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus three relevant elective subjects
Technical School/NABPTEX/CTVET Certificate II: Passes in six subjects (3 core + 3 relevant electives)
level_note: One of two specialised tourism degree programmes at STU.
Graduates work in tourism boards, travel agencies, hotels, eco-tourism ventures, and government tourism departments.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology in Hospitality and Tourism Management

mode: Full-time on-campus lectures with practical kitchen and hospitality lab sessions
Industrial attachment at hotels and catering establishments
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus credit passes in three relevant elective subjects
SSSCE: Credit passes (A-D) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus three relevant elective subjects
HND holders in HCIM or related programmes enter at Level 300
level_note: Combines hospitality management with tourism studies for versatile industry professionals.
Practical training includes hotel operations, food production, and service management.

courses.course_name: HND Hotel Catering and Institutional Management

fees: Ghanaian Students (Regular): GHC 2,440 - 2,840 per semester (fresh); GHC 2,100 - 2,500 (continuing)

courses.course_name: Catering Intermediate (COTVET)

Supervised practical attachment

note: The Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences falls under the Faculty of Applied Science and Technology at STU.
STU introduced the B.Tech Diagnostic Medical Imaging programme in December 2024 for the 2024/2025 academic year, expanding into medical imaging alongside its established pharmacy programmes.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology in Diagnostic Medical Imaging

cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate: 36 or better (science subjects required)
mode: Full-time on-campus with clinical hospital attachments
Practical training at diagnostic imaging centres and hospitals
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus credit passes in three relevant science elective subjects (Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Elective Mathematics)
SSSCE: Credit passes (A-D) in the same subjects
Technical School/NABPTEX/CTVET: Passes in relevant science subjects
level_note: Newly introduced programme (December 2024) training diagnostic radiographers and medical imaging technologists.
Addresses Ghana's critical shortage of trained medical imaging professionals in hospitals and diagnostic centres.

courses.course_name: Bachelor of Technology in Pharmacy Technician

cutt_off: WASSCE aggregate: 36 or better (science subjects required)
mode: Full-time on-campus with laboratory and clinical practicals
Clinical attachments at hospital and community pharmacies
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-C6) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus credit passes in three relevant science elective subjects (Chemistry, Biology, Physics, Elective Mathematics)
SSSCE: Credit passes (A-D) in the same subjects
HND Dispensing Technology holders enter at Level 300

courses.course_name: HND Dispensing Technology

mode: Full-time on-campus with laboratory practicals and clinical attachments
Weekend mode also available
entry_requirements: WASSCE: Credit passes (A1-D7) in English Language, Mathematics, and Integrated Science plus credit passes (A1-C6) in three relevant science elective subjects (Chemistry, Biology, Physics)
SSSCE: Credit passes (A-D) in the same subjects

note: The Department of Building Technology falls under the Faculty of Built Environment and Applied Arts at STU.

courses.course_name: Master of Technology in Construction Technology and Management

fees: Ghanaian Students: Estimated GHC 8,000 - 12,000 per semester (postgraduate rates)
mode: Weekend mode lectures (Fridays and Saturdays)
Research thesis required for completion
